nodes.title: About Me
nodes.info:
Computers and technology have fascinated me from a very early age. I spent a lot of my teenage being the local tech-wiz in my neighborhood. I enjoyed being the one-stop solution for my family and friends - sometimes even friends of friends.

As I grew up, my passion for technology grew as well and I started learning how to code. Coding for me is a way to express my inner self as I’m not much of an extrovert and I like my actions to do most of the talking. I’m a self-taught programmer - my skill is purely driven by passion and I’m always challenging myself to learn new programming languages to feed my interest.

I did my undergraduate degree in Business Administration and not in Computer Science because I felt I would lose my love for programming if I went through an undergraduate course where I would have to be focused on passing exams and GPA at all times. Technology is ever-evolving and there's always something new to learn every day that I didn’t want to limit by enrolling in a 4-year program. 

Even though I didn’t go through a formal Computer Science education I never stopped teaching myself different languages and challenging myself by applying them to make new web applications or websites. I took up many freelance projects to refine my skills and also to stay updated with what was new in the market. After graduation I did what I always loved, I took up a career in Information technology and have enjoyed the flexibility and learning opportunities that came with it. After having worked in this industry for 8 years in my home country - I moved to the UK in 2021, joined a leading edu-tech company called High Speed Training, and I have been working here since and presently as A Software Engineer 2. I know I made the right decision to pursue my passion and I’ve never regretted it.

Besides computers, I am deeply attached to music. I was a Heavy Metal drummer and music composer when I was at University and also had a studio back in Bangladesh, where I had helped many artists record their music for their albums. Ever since I moved to the UK - I now satisfy my cravings to create music by recording Rumi’s poetry for my YouTube channel Inner Sphere. I make the videos and compose the music and currently have 58K+ subscribers.

I’ve been told I’m a perfectionist when it comes to my work and has been loved by my peers at my previous workplaces. My work ethic has usually been appreciated and I like to think of myself as an efficient team player. I’m a simple person with a love for sophisticated technology.
